ch.iserver.ace.util
Class AsyncInterceptor

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.util.AsyncInterceptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.aopalliance.aop.Advice, org.aopalliance.intercept.Interceptor, org.aopalliance.intercept.MethodInterceptor
public class AsyncInterceptor
extends Object
implements org.aopalliance.intercept.MethodInterceptor

AsyncInterceptor is a special method interceptor that adds the intercepted MethodInvocation objects to a BlockingQueue and then returns immediately. Together with a worker thread that reads and executes invocations from the same queue this can be used to execute methods asynchronously.

See Also:
AsyncWorker

Method Detail

dispose

public void dispose()
Disposes this AsyncInterceptor. After disposing, additional calls to invoke(MethodInvocation) should throw an IllegalStateException.

isDisposed

public boolean isDisposed()
Determines whether this AsyncInterceptor has been disposed.

Returns:
true iff the interceptor has been disposed

protected void invokeAsync(org.aopalliance.intercept.MethodInvocation invocation)
Invokes the method invocation asynchronously.

invokeNonVoidMethod

protected Object invokeNonVoidMethod(org.aopalliance.intercept.MethodInvocation invocation)
Invokes a method with a non-void return type. This method can be overriden to customize the behavior in this case.

Parameters:
invocation - the method invocation
Returns:
the result of the invocation or null if the method was invoked asynchronously
